hackathon-description-text: From one of the most iconic buildings in Toronto, the former

hackathon-judges.judge-name: Bruce Croxon | Graham Churchill | Dr. Hossein Rahnama | James Gibbons

hackathon-eligibility:
Anyone is invited to participate in this hackathon.

If you don't have a team, small teams can be formed on the first day of the hackathon. Teams with interdisciplinary skills are typically the most successful ones - a suggestion for a 'good' team mix is to have members with these skill sets:
hackathon-requirements:
Topic:  Sports wearables
The following are technologies and wearables devices that will be available for use at the Hackathon.
Platforms: IBM Bluemix (
Devices: (these devices will be available at the hackathon; you have the option to bring your own wearable device)

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: One winning team will receive: $7500 in cash + wearable devices + hosting (cloud) + ongoing support and mentoring + the opportunity to present your solution at the We Are Wearables November meet-up + the opportunity to demo your app at the IBM booth at the SociaLIGHT conference (Nov 22)
One winning team will receive: $2500 in cash + wearable devices + hosting (cloud) + ongoing support and mentoring
One winning team will receive: $1000 in cash
Three teams will be awarded devices: (1) Raspberry Pis, (2) Hummingboards from SolidRun, (3) Freescale Kinetis Freedom boards with Bluetooth enabled sensor board.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=50 Carlton Street, Toronto, ON M5B 1J2, Canada

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Have you created something completely new/different?
Is this a fun widget or does it have business potential?
How functional was the tech in the demo/pitch?

hackathon-location-address: 50 Carlton Street, Toronto, ON M5B 1J2, Canada
hackathon-description-header: Join this 3-day event, get inspired, and work with fellow hackers to create the next big thing in sports innovation!  Register at www.sportshackweekend.org.
